Package de.htwsaar.config

Interface EnvConfiguration

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClasspathBasedConfig, DynamicConfig
public interface EnvConfiguration
represents a map of configuration key-value.
Author:
hbui

    • getConfigValue

      default String getConfigValue(String configParameter, EnvConfiguration.MissingConfigurationHandler handler)
      returns the value of a configure parameter, or return handler.handleMissingConfiguration() if configure value is null.
      Parameters:
      configParameter - Der Parameter
      handler - Handles missing configuration
      Returns:
      as description
      See Also:
      • getConfigValue(java.lang.String, java.util.function.BiFunction)

    • getConfigValue

      default <R> R getConfigValue(String configParameter, BiFunction<String,String,R> converter)
      Calls converter.apply(configParameter, configValue) to convert the configuration value as string to expected value and type. Example; 
      
 int poolCount = config.getConfigValue("database.poolCount", (String key, String value, int) -> {
     try {
         return Integer.parseInt(value);
     } catch(NumberFormatException ex)  {
         return 1;
     }
 } );
      Parameters:
      configParameter - the configure parameter
      converter - the method calls converter.apply(configParameter, configValue); to calculate the returned result. Lambda Function converter.apply must be able to handle null-value of configValue.
      Returns:
      result of converter.apply(configParameter, configValue);

    • toString

      String toString()
      should return the URL, from which the configuration saved, or null if unknown. Use for Debug only
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the URL, from which the config are saved, or null if unknown!

    • getAllConfigKeys

      Set<String> getAllConfigKeys()

    • resolveImportConfig

      static Map<String,String> resolveImportConfig(File configFile, ConfigParser parser)
      resolve an config-file, which is imported by an other configure-file. This method is intended to be used by an implementation of EnvConfiguration.
      Parameters:
      configFile - the imported configure-file
      parser - a parser, which can parse the configure file.
      Returns:
      configure as a Map of paar of configure-parameter and its value

    • resolveConfigVariables

      static Map<String,String> resolveConfigVariables(Map<String,String> originConfigTable)
      resolve variables in configure values of a configure-parameter. Variables are marked by ${var_name}. var_name should be consist of only numeric-alphabetical character, the minus and underscore character. The special variable HOME is automatically resolved to value of Java-System variable user.home. For example: given a Map of pair of configure parameters and their values: 
       
 application-home=${HOME}/some-dir
 icons-path=${application-home}/icons
 style-path=${application-home}/style
      within a java Runtime with user.home is set to /home/otto. This map is resolved to 
      
 application-home=/home/otto/some-dir
 icons-path=/home/otto/some-dir/icons
 style-path=/home/otto/some-dir/style
      the origin map is not changed.
      Parameters:
      originConfigTable -
      Returns:
      new map, its values are resolved.
      Throws:
      LSConfigException - when at least a variable is not resolved.

    • resolveSystemProperties

      static String resolveSystemProperties(String text)
